article:
In mathematics, and particularly in the theory of automatic groups, 'shortlex'
is a total ordering for finite sequences of objects that can themselves be
totally ordered. In the shortlex ordering, sequences are primarily sorted by
cardinality (length) with the shortest sequences first, and sequences of the
same length are sorted into lexicographical order. Shortlex ordering is also
called 'radix', or 'length-plus-lexicographic' ordering.
